intro: Lipochaeta strigosa, commonly known as the rough hairbush, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Goodeniaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal regions. It has a sprawling growth habit and produces small, yellow or reddish flowers that attract various pollinators. Lipochaeta strigosa is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its ability to stabilize soil and provide habitat for native wildlife.
